summary: This is a supplemental response from a plaintiff to a defendant's request to produce documents in a civil lawsuit (Case No. 08-CV-80811) against Jeffrey Epstein. The plaintiff responds to specific requests for financial records, insurance information, and sensitive materials like photos/videos of sexual acts and lists of sexual partners, indicating 'None' for several items. The document includes a counsel list.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the civil lawsuit (Case No. 08-CV-80811) who is the subject of the plaintiff's document production responses.

persons.name: Robert Critton
persons.context: Listed as counsel, associated with the law firm Burman, Critton, Luttier & Coleman LLP.

persons.name: Jack A. Goldberger
persons.context: Listed as counsel from Atterbury, Goldberger & Weiss, P.A., and is noted as 'Attorney For: Jeffrey Epstein'.

persons.name: Bruce E. Reinhart
persons.context: Listed as counsel from Bruce E. Reinhart, P.A.

connections.description: Goldberger is explicitly listed as 'Attorney For: Jeffrey Epstein' in the counsel list.

events.title: Defendant's First Request to Produce
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's legal team served a formal request for the plaintiff to produce documents, including tax returns, insurance info, and sensitive personal materials.

events.title: Lawsuit Filing
events.description: A civil lawsuit was filed against Jeffrey Epstein (Case No. 08-CV-80811) in the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Plaintiff's Supplemental Response Filed
events.description: The plaintiff filed this supplemental/amended response to Epstein's document requests, answering specific questions about financial records and sexual materials.

keyFacts: The plaintiff in a 2008 civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein responded to requests for documents covering 2002-2007, including tax returns and records of earnings.
The plaintiff denied possessing any photographs, movies, DVDs, or videotapes in which she performed sexual acts or simulated sexual acts, whether for money or not.

The plaintiff was asked to produce documents listing names and addresses of all sexual partners from January 1, 2000, through November 30, 2008; the provided text shows the answer fields but not the responses.
Jack A. Goldberger is explicitly identified in the document as an attorney for Jeffrey Epstein.
The document is subject to a protective order, specifically restricting paragraphs 7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17.
